discourse_list.title: Hypothetically, what would happen if something catastrophic happened with USDC killswitch?

content.content: I am fairly a rube in terms of MKR mechanics, but it is a modest part of my portfolio, so I don’t know if this has been already ideated. But with the USDT awareness growing, and someone asking me why I liked DAI, I am just wondering what it even means if there’s a lot of USDC locked up.

I’m not sure if USDT is there on purpose or as a typo. People have articulated better than me on this forum and on Twitter, but a potential (and highly speculative) scenario is:  we take a hit on USDC (we might even have to mint MKR to pay bad debt and dilute its value) the whole world realizes that decentralized, permissionless, and censorship resistance matters more than they thought someone looking for stablecoins that follow those criteria picks up the phone and ask you why you like DAI you tell them “because it’s decentralized, permissionless, and censorship-resistant” you drop the mic

Also to add, USDC is high right now because people deleverage. If it wasn’t here the peg would have be broken and vault users would had to pay a dai at a least 1.1 to refinance their loan which is a 10% increase on the loan.
